metadata.Title: CVE-2016-4049 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
The bgp_dump_routes_func function in bgpd/bgp_dump.c in Quagga does notperform size checks when dumping data, which might allow remote attackersto cause a denial of service (assertion failure and daemon crash) via alarge BGP packet.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-4049` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

quagga - 0.99.24.1-2ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: quagga package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.99.24.1-2ubuntu1.1').
